properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms tracking eastward from Manitoba are possible beginning early this evening and the threat continues until late this evening. Wind gusts near 90 kilometres per hour are possible. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-07-14T06:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-13T17:07:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3179717360.2020
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park, Kenora - Grassy Narrows - Whitedog, Sioux Narrows - Nestor Falls - Morson, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Ignace - English River, Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Cancelled: Dam Overflow Alert Issued By Riverdale Municipality
properties.Summary:
Description: Cancelled: The MANDATORY EVACUATION in Riverdale Municipality for residents immediately adjacent to the Little Saskatchewan River has been cancelled. Residents can now return to their homes. Please contact the Municipal Office by phone at 204-328-5300 for further information.
Expires: 2020-07-13T18:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-07-13T15:11:54-05:00, 1BEE6F93-6300-D0AA-14F0-00E6E6DDAA3E
Area: Little Saskatchewan River in the Riverdale Municipality
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally heavy downpours this afternoon. A few slow moving thunderstorms or heavy showers north and eastward of Kingston may give up to 30 millimetres of rain within an hour. Reduced visibility while driving and local flooding are possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T02:35:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-13T19:37:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3540436697.2020
Area: Tamworth - Sydenham - South Frontenac, Kingston - Odessa - Frontenac Islands, Westport - Charleston Lake, Gananoque - Mallorytown
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:35 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. A line of thunderstorms is located from Wabowden to Nelson House and is moving northeast at 20 km/h. Training thunderstorms could give heavy downpours up to 75 mm per hour with these storms. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-13T20:34:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-13T17:36:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4287742619.2020
Area: Wabowden, Nelson House
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots. A trough over southern Manitoba is bringing moisture and instability this afternoon and this evening. Thunderstorms have potential to become severe. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-14T03:59:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-13T16:39:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2808888966.2020
Area: Lake Winnipeg - south basin

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and poor to very poor visibility in showers heavy at times. Thunderstorms with poor visibility and gusts to 40 knots are likely during the early evening hours until late evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A narrow band of heavy rain will bring significant rainfall to some locations today and tomorrow. General rainfall amounts are expected to be in the 40 to 60 mm range with local amounts up to 100 mm possible by the time the heaviest rain eases Tuesday afternoon. Showery conditions with local amounts can be expected through mid week. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T08:18:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-13T16:19:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4192648236.2020
Area: Hay River Region including Enterprise
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A cold front tracking across western Manitoba is triggering scattered thunderstorms this afternoon. Some of these thunderstorms may briefly reach severe thresholds. This severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded eastwards as the afternoon and evening progresses. ### Fast-moving water across a road can sweep a vehicle away. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T05:00:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-13T20:15:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0340752939.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A trough over southern Manitoba is bringing moisture and instability this afternoon and this evening. Thunderstorms have potential to become severe. Heavy downpours up to 75 mm per hour and strong winds are possible. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
